meanings.definition: Chacmas: a type of baboon found in southern Africa
meanings.sent1: The chacmas were swinging from tree to tree in the African savanna.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of chacmas grooming each other near the river.
meanings.sent3: The chacmas decided to have a dance party in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The chacmas' playful antics reminded me of mischievous children.
meanings.sent5: The loud calls of the chacmas echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: Chacmas: plural form of chacma, referring to more than one chacma baboon
meanings.sent1: The zoo welcomed a new exhibit featuring the playful chacmas.
meanings.sent2: Tourists were excited to see the chacmas interacting in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The chacmas surprised everyone by putting on a fashion show with leaves and twigs.
meanings.sent4: The chacmas' unity and teamwork were admirable during the feeding time.
meanings.sent5: The chacmas' intelligence shone through as they solved puzzles for treats.
